poem:
"Eskil At the Precipice"

Upon mountain's prominences,
they perched - Atle and Eskil,
before the yawning maw of earth.
It was Spring. Ice lingered,
like half-remembered dreams.
Image held in light's abrupt collision,
captured the audacity of courage,
silhouetted against the immeasurable.
Scaled in lonesome venture - 
the elemental story of man,
life's persistent metaphor.
For here, in nature's stark theater,
the pulse of life embellishes its dance.
